page.title: 02MIDFORD AND TUCKING MILL
page.content: Midford is no longer a village in the true sense.The station has closed and the busy Frome road cuts straight between the houses.There is still a pub,but the shops,post officeand chapel have gone.It has never had a school or church,and nowadays most of the inhabitants only meet at specially arranged gatherings.The banks of the Midford Brook and neighbouring fields are lovely for walking;and its valley between Midford and Tucking Mill is dominated by a spectacular eighteenth century castle. At Tucking Mill there are seven houses,a reservoir and water treatment plant.Disabled anglers are allowed to fis there and the whole area is a popular place for walking,with its fields,streams and wildlife.Those who live in Tucking Mill and Midford rely heavily on cars to get about.
